story.description:
Implement HAIAMM Education & Guidance (EG) practice at Level 1 maturity.

## Practice Overview

**Function:** Governance
**Purpose:** Train teams on AI security best practices

## Level 1 Objectives

Establish basic AI security awareness and resource availability.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Awareness materials created or curated
  - Prompt injection explanation
  - AI-specific risks overview
  - Reporting procedures

- [ ] Training audience identified
  - Developers building AI features
  - Users of AI systems
  - Security team members

- [ ] Resource library established
  - OWASP AI resources collected
  - Vendor security docs gathered
  - Internal guidelines documented

- [ ] Communication channel created
  - Slack channel, email list, or wiki
  - Regular update cadence defined
  - Initial announcement made

## Definition of Done

- [ ] All acceptance criteria met
- [ ] Training materials accessible
- [ ] Communication channel active
- [ ] Initial awareness session conducted

## OWASP Risks Addressed

- ASI09: Human-Agent Trust Exploitation
- All risks (awareness reduces exploitation)

## Resources

- [EG Practice Guide](https://github.com/R3v3rzk1mur4/HAIAMM/docs/practices/EG-Software-OnePager.md)
- [OWASP AI Security Resources](https://owasp.org/www-project-ai-security/)

## Verifhai Integration

Use `/verifhai-practice EG` for guided implementation assistance.

subtasks.description: Develop or curate basic training content on AI security risks.
Document who needs AI security training by role.
Collect and organize AI security references and guides.
Create channel for AI security updates and discussions.
